verses.text: The burden of the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* to Israel by Malachi.\f + \fr 1.1 \ft by…: Heb. by the hand of\f*

I have loved you, saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*. Yet ye say , Wherein hast thou loved us? \add Was\add* not Esau Jacob’s brother ? saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*: yet I loved Jacob ,
And I hated Esau , and laid his mountains and his heritage waste for the dragons of the wilderness.

Whereas Edom saith , We are impoverished , but we will return and build the desolate places ; thus saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* of hosts , They shall build , but I will throw down ; and they shall call them, The border of wickedness , and, The people against whom the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* hath indignation for ever.
And your eyes shall see , and ye shall say , The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* will be magnified from the border of Israel.\f + \fr 1.5 \ft from: or, upon: Heb. from upon\f* \p

¶ A son honoureth \add his\add* father , and a servant his master : if then I \add be\add* a father , where \add is\add* mine honour ? and if I \add be\add* a master , where \add is\add* my fear ? saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts unto you, O priests , that despise my name. And ye say , Wherein have we despised thy name ?

Ye offer polluted bread upon mine altar ; and ye say , Wherein have we polluted thee? In that ye say , The table of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add is\add* contemptible.\f + \fr 1.7 \ft offer…: or, bring unto, etc\f*

And if ye offer the blind for sacrifice , \add is it\add* not evil ? and if ye offer the lame and sick , \add is it\add* not evil ? offer it now unto thy governor ; will he be pleased with thee, or accept thy person ? saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts.\f + \fr 1.8 \ft for: Heb. to\f*

And now, I pray you, beseech God that he will be gracious unto us: this hath been by your means : will he regard your persons ? saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts.\f + \fr 1.9 \ft God: Heb. the face of God\f*\f + \fr 1.9 \ft by…: Heb. from your hand\f*

Who \add is there\add* even among you that would shut the doors \add for nought?\add* neither do ye kindle \add fire\add* on mine altar for nought. I have no pleasure in you, saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts , neither will I accept an offering at your hand.

For from the rising of the sun even unto the going down of the same my name \add shall be\add* great among the Gentiles ; and in every place incense \add shall be\add* offered unto my name , and a pure offering : for my name \add shall be\add* great among the heathen , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts. \p
¶ But ye have profaned it, in that ye say , The table of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add is\add* polluted ; and the fruit thereof, \add even\add* his meat , \add is\add* contemptible.

Ye said also, Behold, what a weariness \add is it!\add* and ye have snuffed at it, saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* of hosts ; and ye brought \add that which was\add* torn , and the lame , and the sick ; thus ye brought an offering : should I accept this of your hand ? saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.  +  r 1.13  t and ye have…: or, whereas ye might have blown it away *

But cursed \add be\add* the deceiver , which hath in his flock a male , and voweth , and sacrificeth unto the Lord a corrupt thing : for I \add am\add* a great King , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts , and my name \add is\add* dreadful among the heathen.\f + \fr 1.14 \ft which…: Heb. in whose flock is\f*
